entries.title: Arts Calendar: Happenings for the Week of June 2
entries.description: Charli XCX drops a club album with ‘Brat,’ live-action ‘Star Wars’ returns with ‘The Acolyte,’  Ishana Night Shyamalan makes her directorial debut with ‘The Watchers’ and more.

entries.title: New York Prosecutor Was First to Charge a Former President. Now He Weighs Seeking to Imprison One.
entries.description: Alvin Bragg, the first Black Manhattan district attorney, campaigned on the promise of enforcing the laws equally among the rich and poor.

entries.title: China's Defense Chief Turns Down Temperature on Tensions With U.S.
entries.description: China’s Adm. Dong Jun sought to assuage fears of confrontation between the Chinese and American militaries a day after the U.S. defense chief did the same.

entries.title: Russia Aims to Make Life Unlivable in Ukraine's Second City
entries.description: Ukraine has halted Russia’s advance toward Kharkiv, though officials say Moscow appears to be planning a grinding war of attrition to empty the city of its population by making life there untenable.

entries.title: A Landslide Buried a Village at 3 a.m. Could It Have Been Predicted?
entries.description: A landslide that hit Papua New Guinea’s highlands last month has put a renewed focus on efforts to better forecast when and where landslides might happen.

entries.title: The CEO Trying to Smooth U.S.-China Tensions in Farm Country
entries.description: Jeff Rowe is fighting criticism over pesticide giant Syngenta’s foreign ownership.

entries.title: 'She Hooked Me': How an Online Scam Cost a Senior Citizen His Life's Savings
entries.description: She convinced him she was a rich young Chinese immigrant looking for love. After bleeding him dry, she ghosted him. He still longs for her.

entries.title: How Israel Avoided Biden's Red Line
entries.description: The original plan for a two-division sweep through Rafah was retooled to address U.S. concerns.

entries.title: The Multimillion-Dollar Scandal Rocking Pickleball
entries.description: Hundreds of retirees and other creditors say a man who sold Pickleball Rocks merchandise at tournaments across the U.S. owes them nearly $50 million.

entries.title: The Brady Bunch Breaks Down: Estate Fights Tear Stepfamilies Apart
entries.description: In standard estate plans, a surviving spouse often has no legal obligation to stepchildren.

entries.title: More »
entries.description: It was a beacon for the superrich. Now, people are taking giant losses to get out of 432 Park.

entries.title: More »
entries.description: Why Bruce Springsteen’s America was never real

entries.title: Boeing's Starliner Launch Delayed Minutes Before Takeoff
entries.description: NASA said the next launch attempt could take place as soon as Wednesday.

entries.title: Real Madrid Does It Again to Lift Champions League for Record 15th Time
entries.description: Los Blancos once again felt inevitable on European soccer’s biggest stage as they outlasted Borussia Dortmund in a 2-0 victory.

entries.title: Why Biden's Cease-Fire Push in Gaza Faces Tough Obstacles
entries.description: President Biden’s call for an end to the Israel-Hamas war was designed to make it hard for either side to say no. But disagreements on crucial details remain hard to overcome.

entries.title: Boeing's Starliner Set to Launch NASA Astronauts
entries.description: Watch live coverage of NASA’s Boeing Starliner crewed flight test, with astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams, to the International Space Station.

entries.title: Americans Weigh In on Trump Conviction. 'Vote for the Lesser of Evils.'
entries.description: In battleground states, the guilty verdict has amplified dread over the 2024 vote among voters who are undecided or only lightly committed to a candidate.

entries.title: A New Bone of Contention: Trigger Warnings in Archaeology Class
entries.description: Professors from Harvard to Cambridge feel obliged to caution students before displaying ancient human remains; drawings and plastic skeletons fill the void.

entries.title: More »
entries.description: The growing battleground between economy fliers and airlines: foot hammocks

entries.title: San Francisco's Most Expensive Home for Sale Has a Pretty Impressive Guest List
entries.description: The late philanthropists Fritz and Lucy Jewett used the $38 million Presidio home to entertain Nancy Pelosi, George H.W. Bush and others.
